revised_title: Experimental Analysis of Standing Waves and Wave Instability
tldr: The author conducted experiments to study standing waves and their instability. They found that when the height of the crests of standing waves reaches about the wavelength, they become pointed in the form of a ridge. The experiments confirmed Penney and Price's predictions about the instability of two-dimensional waves and revealed the development of three-dimensional instability. The findings contribute to the understanding of fluid dynamics and wave mechanics.
